faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes, for specific investment criteria. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent appreciation (+8% annually in Vera), established tourism infrastructure supporting rental income, and relatively accessible entry pricing compared to Northern Europe. However, location specificity matters significantly—Vera offers better value than saturated areas like Benidorm or Marbella. Successful buyers clearly define investment parameters (holiday letting vs. long-term residential) and account for management requirements.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU and EU citizens can purchase Spanish property with equal rights. No residency requirement exists; property ownership doesn't automatically grant residency, though property purchases facilitate visa applications. Documentation includes NIE (tax identification number), proof of funds, and legal representation. Foreign ownership is straightforward; additional layers involving mortgage qualification, tax planning, and legal clarity benefit from experienced legal representation.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs include transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), legal fees (€600-1,500), notary fees (€200-400), and real estate agent commission (3-5%). For this €285,000 property, anticipate approximately €30,000-35,000 in additional acquisition costs. Annual ownership costs include property tax (0.4-0.75% of cadastral value), community fees (if applicable), utilities, and maintenance. Mortgage origination fees and insurance add if financing.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.75% of cadastral value, typically €1,000-2,000 annually for €285,000 properties. Additionally, non-resident property owners pay 19% income tax on estimated rental yields (regardless of actual income), creating tax planning importance for investment properties. EU residents may benefit from different tax frameworks; professional tax advice optimizes strategy. Community fees (HOA-equivalent) apply if applicable.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers commonly secure Spanish mortgages through established lenders. Typical requirements include 20-40% deposit, proof of income (often requiring recent tax returns), NIE number, and legal representation. Interest rates typically range 2.5-4% for EU citizens; non-EU buyers may face slightly higher rates. Mortgage terms extend to 30 years. Specialized mortgage brokers navigate foreign applicant documentation and expedite approval processes.

faqs.question: What is the climate like in Vera?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean subtropical climate with 320+ annual sunshine days, mild winters (average 10-15°C), and warm summers (28-32°C). Rainfall concentrates in autumn/winter months; summer drought is typical. Coastal breezes moderate temperature extremes. Climate supports year-round outdoor activities and tourism, sustaining both seasonal and permanent residency. Compared to Northern Europe, weather facilitates outdoor living and reduces heating expenses.
